sentences.sentence: In his distress( 痛苦 ) of mind, the man promised her everything.
When the child was born the witch( 女巫 ) appeared, and, giving the child the name of Rapunzel (which is another word for rampion( 莴苣 )), she took it away with her.
Rapunzel was the most beautiful child in the world.
When she was twelve years old the witch shut her up in a tower in the middle of a wood.
The tower had neither steps nor door, only a small window above.
When the witch wished to be let in, she would stand below and would cry, “Rapunzel, Rapunzel! Let down your hair!”
Rapunzel had beautiful long hair that shone like gold.
When she heard the voice of the witch she would open the upper( 上面的 ) window, undo( 解开 ) the plaits( 发辫 ) of her hair, and let it down thirty feet( 英尺 ) below, and the witch would climb up by it.
After they had lived like this a few years, one day a King’s son was riding through the wood.
He came to the tower, and as he came near he heard a voice singing so sweetly that he stood still and listened.
It was Rapunzel in her loneliness trying to pass away( 消磨 ) the time with sweet songs.
The King’s son wished to go in to her, and tried to find a door in the tower, but there was none.
So he rode home, but the song had entered into his heart, and every day he went into the wood and listened to it.
Once, as he was standing there under a tree, he saw the witch come near, and listened while she called out, “Rapunzel, Rapunzel! Let down your hair.”
Then he saw how Rapunzel let down her long hair, and how the witch climbed up by it and went in to her. He said to himself,
“Since that is the ladder( 梯子 ) I will climb it, and seek( 寻找 ) my fortune( 运气 ).”
And the next day, as soon as it began to grow dusk( 薄暮 ), he went to the tower and cried,
“Rapunzel, Rapunzel! Let down your hair.”
And she let down her hair, and the King’s son climbed up by it.
Rapunzel was greatly terrified( 害怕的 ) when she saw that a man had come in to her, for she had never seen one before.
But the King’s son began speaking kindly to her.
He told her how her singing had entered into his heart, so that he could have no peace until he had seen her.
Then Rapunzel forgot her fear, and when he asked her to take him for her husband, and she saw that he was young and handsome, she thought to herself,
“I certainly like him much better than old mother Gothel,” and she put her hand into his hand, saying,
“I would willingly go with you, but I do not know how I shall get out. Every time you come, bring some rope.
I will make a ladder( 梯子 ) with it, and when it is quite ready I will get down by it out of the tower, and you shall take me away on your horse.”
They agreed that he should come to her every evening, as the old woman came in the daytime( 白天 ).
So the witch knew nothing of all this until once Rapunzel said to her innocently( 天真地 ), by mistake( 无意地 ),
“Mother Gothel, how is it that you climb up here so slowly, and the King’s son is with me in a moment?”
“Oh? wicked( 邪恶的 ) child,” cried the witch, “what is this I hear! I thought I had hidden you from all the world, and you have betrayed( 背叛 ) me!”
In her anger she seized( 抓住 ) Rapunzel by her beautiful hair, struck( 打 ) her several times with her left hand,
and then taking a pair of( 一把 ) scissors in her right hand—snip( 剪断 ), snap( 剪断 )—the beautiful long hair lay on the ground.
And she was so hard-hearted that she took Rapunzel and put her in a deserted( 空寂无人的 ) place where nothing grew, and where she lived in great sorrow( 悲伤 ) and misery( 痛苦 ).
The same day on which she took Rapunzel away, she went back to the tower in the evening and fastened( 系牢 ) the hair that she had cut to the window frame( 框 ).
The King’s son came and cried,
“Rapunzel, Rapunzel! Let down your hair.”
Then she let the hair down, and the King’s son climbed up, but instead of his dearest Rapunzel he found the witch looking at him with shining, wicked( 恶毒的 ) eyes.
“Aha!” cried she, making fun of( 嘲笑 ) him, “you came for your darling( 宝贝儿 ), but the sweet bird sits no longer in the nest( 笼子 ), and sings no more.
The cat has got her, and will scratch( 刮 ) out your eyes as well! You have lost Rapunzel, and you will never see her again.”
The King’s son, in his agony( 极度痛苦 ) of grief( 悲痛 ), jumped from the tower.
He escaped( 逃走 ) with life, but the thorns( 荆棘 ) on which he fell went through his eyes, so that he could no longer see.
Then he wandered( 游荡 ) blind through the wood, eating nothing but roots( 树根 ) and berries( 浆果 ), and doing nothing but crying and weeping( 哭泣 ) for the loss of his dearest wife.
So he wandered several years in misery, until at last he came to the deserted place where Rapunzel lived with her twin( 双胞胎 ) children that she had given birth to( 生下 ), a boy and a girl.
He heard a voice that he thought he knew.
When he reached the place that it seemed to come from, Rapunzel knew him, and fell on his neck and wept.
And when her tears( 眼泪 ) touched his eyes, they became clear again, and he could see with them as well as ever.
Then he took her to his kingdom, where he was received with great joy( 欢欣 ), and there they lived long and happily.

question.cn: 当Rapunzel看到一个男人进来时，是何感受？
question.en: How was Rapunzel when she saw that a man had come into the tower?

analysis: 文中提到：“Rapunzel was greatly terrified when she saw that a man had come in to her, for she had never seen one before.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 女巫是怎么知道Rapunzel和王子相会的事的？

options.en: The witch forced Rapunzel to tell her.

question.en: What did the witch do to the prince?

options.cn: 她诅咒王子再也看不到Rapunzel。
options.en: She cursed the prince so that he would never see Rapunzel again.

analysis: 文中提到：“'Aha!' cried she, making fun of him, ‘you came for your darling, but the sweet bird sits no longer in the nest, and sings no more. The cat has got her, and will scratch out your eyes as well! You have lost Rapunzel, and you will never see her again.’”女巫无情地嘲讽王子，并诅咒猫抓瞎王子的眼睛，这样王子就再也看不到Rapunzel了，因此答案选B。
